description:
Little Petya likes to play very much. And most of all he likes to play the following game:

He is given a sequence of $ N $ integer numbers. At each step it is allowed to increase the value of any number by $ 1 $ or to decrease it by $ 1 $ . The goal of the game is to make the sequence non-decreasing with the smallest number of steps. Petya is not good at math, so he asks for your help.

The sequence $ a $ is called non-decreasing if $ a_{1}<=a_{2}<=...<=a_{N} $ holds, where $ N $ is the length of the sequence.
inputFormat: The first line of the input contains single integer $ N $ ( $ 1<=N<=5000 $ ) — the length of the initial sequence. The following $ N $ lines contain one integer each — elements of the sequence. These numbers do not exceed $ 10^{9} $ by absolute value.
outputFormat: Output one integer — minimum number of steps required to achieve the goal.
translation: 给定一个序列，每次操作可以把某个数加上 $1$ 或减去 $1$。要求把序列变成非降数列。最小化操作次数。
